title.narrative: Developing Access to Skills and Trade for Growth of Agri-Business

description.narrative: DASTGAH is increasing food security for rural communities and contributing to the overall poverty alleviation strategy of the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan by fostering links between farmers and the market, thus increasing household incomes. This is accomplished through increased sustainable production, sales and skills of actors along agriculture value chains in central Helmand. DASTGAH focuses on the long term agriculture development needs in the central Helmand economic corridor between Garmser and Gereshk through proven agriculture interventions and building on past and existing programs, and relying on the community and government partnerships we have developed in over 20 years of experience in southern Afghanistan. Mercy Corps addresses specific constraints at the producer level to improve the quality and quantity of production and increase the potential market income. DASTGAH facilitates the strengthening of market linkages, assisting producers to identify local, inter‐provincial and international markets for their products. While improvements in quality and quantity of production, together with strengthened market linkages, increase household incomes in the agriculture subsector, the development of capacity within targeted value chains will create employment through organizations and enterprises providing goods and services to producers, processors and marketers of agricultural goods.
